messages: 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:43): hey guys
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:43): not sure if anybody's here right now but anyways
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:43): i don't remember who exactly but somebody was wondering about san francisco javascript meetup the other day
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:44): i spoke to matt (organizer of the js meetup) today and he wants to organize one in february. so if you want to talk, let me know
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:52): i'm about to go to bed, but i'll say hi at least 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:52): ohai
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:52): sleep is for sissies
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:52): consider me a girl
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:53): to make up for it, know that with curl and some preg_match, i can now decently effectively sniff for doctypes
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:54): oh neat
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:54): you earned 8 hours of sleep then, haha
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (09:54): (sorry, i am intoxicated right now)
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:54): regex made me want to give myself a haircut
bd31df6485a5054cf7eca3994c3cb897 (09:54): regular expressions would make anyone want to cut things
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:55): more or less, i have nested preg_matches
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:55): first one looks in a curl return of 150bytes for any instance of DOCTYPE
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:55): second one looks for "html p" with case insensitive searching
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:56): and since html5 doctype has "html>", it returns negative, and the rest return either no doctype or positive, and that's all i needed anyway
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:56): html5 vs the rest vs none
bd31df6485a5054cf7eca3994c3cb897 (09:57): why do you need to do that? if you write the doc you know what doctype it is
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:57): if anyone thinks of a better way, or perhaps a way to regex "html>", i'd greatly appreciate the string to use
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:57): but this is for an hcard plugin for wordpress, and i can't know who's going to use which
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:58): general plan is...if html5 doctype, tack on the hcard profile link to the wp_head()
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:58): if not, leave a note somewhere saying to apply the profile link to the <head> tag
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:59): and maybe "come with me if you want to live" in an austrian accent
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (10:00): anyways, i've rambled enough and it's 3am
c41d451ed773297423055eb1b05dcbd2 (10:03): what a cool guy
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:17): hey people
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:17): what statistical data from sites are you interested in?
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:18): disqus is installed on tons of websites and i am going to gather some nice data (libraries on the page, their versions, built-in objects redefined, etc.)
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:18): if you have something interesting in mind you want to gather from half a million websites or 350 mln unique monthly visitors, let me know
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:19): that's my projects for next week and the data will be ready in a month
cdea6075efa225e2e4e3562bb9ea66c3 (10:22): that sounds very interesting anton
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:22): yeah i am pretty excited about that
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:22): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596: might be worth posting to the whatwg mailing list to ask
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:23): http://lists.whatwg.org/listinfo.cgi/whatwg-whatwg.org
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:23): 1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608, will do tomorrow
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:24): let me just write it down so i don't forget
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:28): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596: some of the kinds of stats that have been useful in the work on the html5 spec -
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:28): http://code.google.com/webstats/index.html
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:29): and data like the Opera MAMA reports
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:29): http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/mama/
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:29): e.g., http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/mama-phrase-block-list/#phrase
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:30): awesome
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (10:30): http://philip.html5.org/data.html

4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (10:34): thanks man. i skimmed over those pages, don't know if it is a good idea to gather all at once. but i am pretty sure i will be able to get some very useful info.
